meanings.definition: To walk with short steps, swaying from side to side
meanings.sent1: The duck waddled across the pond.
meanings.sent2: The penguin likes to waddle on the ice.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to waddle like a duck, but kept falling over.
meanings.sent4: The elderly man waddled slowly with his cane, resembling a penguin.
meanings.sent5: The baby's first waddle was a memorable moment for the family.

meanings.sent1: The duck has a cute little waddle.
meanings.sent2: The penguin's waddle is unique among birds.
meanings.sent3: The waddle of the duckling made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The waddle of the elderly man was a comforting sight.
meanings.sent5: The waddle of the toddler was endearing to watch.

meanings.sent1: The puppy's waddle was adorable to see.
meanings.sent2: The clown's waddle brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The waddle of the robot made it seem more human-like.
meanings.sent4: The waddle of the drunk man was comical to onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The penguin's waddle was a comical sight at the zoo.
